data.title: SIROCCO: Simulating Ionization and Radiation in Outflows Created by Compact Objects
data.name: sirocco
data.description: This is the repository for Sirocco, the radiative transfer code used to model winds in AGN and other systems

evidence: README mentions binaries/installers: "If you want to download the latest dev version, you can zip up the git repository by clicking on the zip icon to the right of the GitHub page. Aternatively, you can clone the repository using"

"Sirocco ... is a Monte Carlo radiative transfer code which uses the Sobolev approximation. ... The code has been used for a variety of research projects invovling the winds of cataclysmic variables, young stellar objects, X-ray binaries and AGN."

"Sirocco and the various routines associated are set up in a self-contained directory structure. The basic directory structure and the data files that one needs to run Sirocco need to be retrieved and compiled."
